sentence: A U.S. Coast Guard helicopter lifts off during a medical evacuation of people injured in Saturday's 7.2 magnitude earthquake, in Les Cayes, Haiti, August 17, 2021.
label: resilience

sentence: REUTERS/Estailove St-Val
label: other

sentence: LES CAYES, Aug 18 (Reuters) - Days before a powerful earthquake struck, Rosemond Clermont paid the $1,554 rent on the office of his construction business in southern Haiti for the rest of the year.
label: resilience

sentence: On Saturday morning, the investment vanished when his small shop collapsed along with hundreds of other buildings in his home town as the coastal city of Les Cayes began crumbling.
label: buildings

sentence: "I don't know what to do.
label: other

sentence: I'm still in shock," said Clermont, 36, the main breadwinner for a family of four.
label: other

sentence: Dozens of businesses ranging from hotels, restaurants to corner shops in downtown Les Cayes and surrounding areas suffered a similar fate, with premises either badly damaged or flattened.
label: buildings

sentence: Clermont said the loss capped a tough few years.
label: resilience

sentence: He opened the construction business four years ago with the help of a bank loan worth $5,180 to supplement another job at a cell phone service provider, worried that he otherwise would not be able to feed his wife, daughter, 4, and 1-year-old son.
label: other

sentence: The loan saddled Clermont with a monthly debt of $207 that he is struggling to pay off.
label: other

sentence: "The economic situation is so much worse than before," he said.
label: resilience

sentence: "I owe money to the bank, we have nowhere to sleep, and I have my family to feed."
label: other

sentence: Since a devastating earthquake that killed tens of thousands of people in 2010, Haiti's economy has been buffeted by chronic political instability, drought and a major hurricane in 2016.
label: resilience

sentence: Opposition-backed protests against the government dragged Haiti into recession in 2019 before the coronavirus pandemic even hit, and a steady deprecation in the gourde currency has put pressure on businesses heavily reliant on foreign imports.
label: resilience

sentence: Haitian economist Etzer Emile told Reuters that in the past, small businesses have been overlooked in post-disaster responses.
label: resilience

sentence: "And that's the big mistake," he said.
label: other

sentence: "Because these entities are the very backbone of the national economy."
label: other

sentence: Clermont's family has been spending nights in the car since the earthquake, scared of possible structural damage at their home after they watched the walls shake violently.
label: buildings

sentence: The entire facade of Clermont's office has gone, and as he stood outside the now empty shell, he warily kept his distance from the battered building lest it crumble further.
label: buildings

sentence: "I don't know how to get out of this," he said.
label: other

sentence: "It's a crisis for me."
label: other
